text: Queen Elizabeth II distributes the traditional Maundy money during the Royal Maundy Service at St George's Chapel on March 29, 2018 in Windsor. ( Photo : WPA Pool, Getty Images ) Prince Philip, Queen Elizabeth II's 96 - year - old husband, missed an annual pre - Easter church service Thursday, setting off worry about his health, according to British media reports. The Telegraph and People reported the Duke of Edinburgh skipped the annual Royal Maundy Service because of a problem with his hip. The queen, 91, did attend and handed out the coins that are a key part of the ceremony. As he usually does, the prince was scheduled to join his wife at the service, held this year at St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle, where their grandson, Prince Harry, is to marry American actress Meg
